ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: External guests to saying information on metrics and environmental consulting
- allowed for interaction with engaged and interesting clients
Autonomy for projects; flexible class/team meetings with the professor schedule; chance to consult on an important sustainability project for a company.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The flow of the class isn't clear; it's a project-based class but it still seemed disorganized.
- comments for instructor could be clearer and more constructive - could have been greater diversity of projects and business sectors represented

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Some lectures were applicable to my project, but not all.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It helps to translate what has been taught to working with real life company

- I had hoped that this course would connect more strongly with my overall programs but because of the low number of students taking the course and lack of diversity of interest, this was not possible. The course was still very beneficial in pushing me to see things in a new light, but was not very interconnected with my academic or professional goals.

The project I worked on during the class exposed me to new material in the energy field which I would not have gotten had I not enrolled in this project course. It was a good learning experience for me.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to take a class outside of SOM and a project-based class seemed like a good idea since I imagined it would be very hands on.
Because it is a requirement to graduating and wanted to work with a real company in solving an environmental issue
- To explore the intersection of forestry, agriculture and business and understand how sustainability works in large companies.
For practical sustainability consulting experience with a for-profit company.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Not really, I don't think I learned specific skills that I didn't have before.
Yes

- No, I did not feel that my team was pushing itself toward quality work and felt ineffective in being able to encourage that shift. I was not able to gain the sectoral expertise that I sought going into the course. However, the course was still an important and positive part of my academic program.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The project was a lot of work at the end of the semester, so being in a group helped spread out the work load.
Advantages include division of work. Disadvantage include alignment teammate time

Advantages: - getting to know an interesting group of people - Benefitting from their areas of expertise and interest Disadvantages: - Feeling that we were not pushing ourselves enough (myself included) - Insecurity about the collective quality of our work (feel like this project might have been accomplished more effectively by 1 individual) - Feeling that we did not have a group vision/clarity on objectives, and that this had ripple effects on the quality and efficiency of our work
The team setting worked well and we had to evaluate each other throughout the semester. This kept everyone on their toes to deliver.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Gives a real company you can work with in solving an environmental challenge

- Come in with an open mind, and try to earnestly take into account Maureen's comments and the reading ease component into your work - Take the opportunity to engage with your client as often as they are interested
